channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023080532
item.description:
Report X-2023080532

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080532 SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTLE WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. 2. X-2023080533 SequenceEvent: QA NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING WHILE CLEANING ANOTHER LEAKING PACKAGE. THIS PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND SPILL WAS CLEANED UP. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTLE WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

Report E-2023080318

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 of the poly 5 gallon pails of finish remover (un3267) had leaked and had released 10 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

QA PLACED PACKAGE IN HAZMAT BAG AND TOTE AND REMOVED FROM HIGH TRAFFIC AREA DescribePack: BOX WAS ON ITS SIDE IN THE TRAILER AND SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID LEAKED FROM THE CAP DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: BAGGED AND REMOVED FROM TRAFFIC, TIGHTENED CAP

item.title: Report E-2023080050
item.description:
Report E-2023080050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Four drums of Morpholine (UN2054) were the only cargo left during the unloading process of a trailer. An odor was detected, therefore, a contractor was requested on site for further assessment of the situation. It was discovered that two of the four drums had potentially released approximately one-gallon of product onto the trailer floor throughout transit. The cause is likely corrosion identified at the bottom of the two drums. The drums were overpacked by the contractor.

item.title: Report X-2023080041

Report X-2023080041

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS FOUND LEAKING WHEN IT GOT TO THE OUTBOUND TRAILER. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report E-2023070997
item.description:
Report E-2023070997

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: OSBORNE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 1, 2023, at 1654 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Osborne, Kansas regarding the release of approximately 1065 gallons of WGS2035 Gas Sweetener (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., (methanol), UN1993, 3, III) from (4) 330-gallon poly totes, reportedly due to a rollover vehicle accident and was contained to a 100' x 15' area of soil shoulder of the road. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized and staged offsite at the Kansas DOT salvage yard for proper disposal.
